The characteristics of an assembly of th: Senior mendicants are not indulgent or slack, nor are they backsliders
They take the lead in seclusion
They rouse energy for attaining the unattained, achieving the unachieved, and realizing the unrealized
Those who come afterwards follow their example
The characteristics of a divided assembl: They continually wound each other with barbed words
The characteristics of a harmonious asse: Mendicants live in harmony, appreciating each other
They blend like milk and water
They regard each other with kindly eyes
The benefits of living in a harmonious a: They live in a holy dwelling, that is, the heart’s release by rejoicing
When they’re joyful, rapture springs up
When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil
When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss
When they’re blissful, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi
